data.title: All 38 Rachel McAdams Movies (in Order)

Get ready for a thrilling ride through the cinematic world of the talented actress, Rachel McAdams! In this roundup article, we explore her diverse and captivating filmography, diving into her most memorable roles and discussing the impact she has made on the industry. From romantic comedies to intense dramas, Rachel McAdams Movies provides an engaging overview of her illustrious career.

1. Perfect Pie (2002)

Perfect Pieâ€ is a heartfelt drama that delves into the complexities of female friendship and the impact of childhood traumas. It follows the reunion of Marie and Patsy, two childhood friends who part ways after an unexpected tragedy shatters their bond.

2. My Name Is Tanino (2002)

My Name Is Taninoâ€ is a delightful romantic comedy that follows the adventure of an Italian tourist named Tanino, as he embarks on a journey across the United States. In search of the girl he met during his summer vacation, Tanino must face the real American dream while dealing with unexpected twists and turns along the way.

3. The Hot Chick (2002)

The Hot Chick is a hilarious yet bizarre comedy-fantasy that takes body-swapping to new heights. Rob Schneider stars as a nerdy high school loser, who gets accidentally transformed into the body of a beautiful, popular teenager played by Rachel McAdams. As they navigate life in each otherâ€™s shoes, they find themselves embarking on a wild odyssey of self-discovery and romantic misadventures.

4. Guilt by Association (2002)

Guilt by Association is a riveting crime drama thriller that captures the essence of true love and betrayal. The story follows Susan, a single mother with a newfound sense of happiness, as she starts a romantic relationship with Russell, who appears to be a loving partner. However, her perfect world is shattered when she uncovers Russellâ€™s dark secret: he is a notorious drug dealer.

5. The Notebook (2004)

The Notebookâ€ (2004) is a captivating drama-romance film set in the late 1940s and 1950s. The story revolves around two young, passionately in love individuals from different social backgrounds, whose romance faces numerous obstacles. As an elderly man reads the heart-wrenching tale to a woman suffering from dementia in a nursing home, she is reminded of her past, the love she had for the one who once read to her.

6. Mean Girls (2004)

Mean Girls, â€œ a 2004 comedy movie directed by Mark Waters, centers around Cady Heron, a high school girl whose transition to a new school leads her to join the elite and notorious clique, The Plastics. However, her life takes a turn when she unknowingly falls for Aaron Samuels, an ex-boyfriend of Regina George, the Alpha Plastic. The film, which features an all-star cast including Lindsay Lohan, Jonathan Bennett, and Rachel McAdams, explores themes of friendship, betrayal, and the perilous landscape of high school politics. With a PG-13 rating, a runtime of 1 hour and 37 minutes, and a whopping 429,000 votes on IMDb, Mean Girls is a beloved comedy that has garnered 7 awards and 25 nominations. Boasting a stellar $130 million worldwide gross, Mean Girls stands as a hallmark of contemporary teenage girl comedies, captivating audiences with its satirical take on the high school experience. â€œ

Starring Owen Wilson, Vince Vaughn, and Rachel McAdams, this light-hearted and entertaining movie follows the story of two committed womanizers, John Beckwith and Jeremy Grey, who sneak into weddings to take advantage of the romantic atmosphere.

Married Lifeâ€ is a captivating 1940s drama where an adulterous man plots his wifeâ€™s demise rather than subjecting her to the public humiliation of a divorce. 14. The Lucky Ones (2008)

Returning home from the horrors of war, three soldiers from very different backgrounds unexpectedly find solace in each otherâ€™s company. A woman with a fierce dedication to her family, a man still haunted by the memories of war, and a man who just wants to live the American dream â€” each one will learn valuable lessons about hope, loss, and the power of unity in â€œThe Lucky Onesâ€. This heartwarming adventure-comedy-drama takes an honest look at the realities faced by our brave service members upon their return to civilian life.

C. , where a congressional aideâ€™s death leads a journalist, played by Russell Crowe, to delve into a political conspiracy involving a Representative, his old college friend.

17. Sherlock Holmes (2009)

Sherlock Holmes, â€œ directed by Guy Ritchie, is a riveting action-adventure film that combines mystery, wit, and suspense. Set in the 19th century, the film follows the legendary detective Sherlock Holmes (played by Robert Downey Jr. ) and his steadfast partner Dr. John Watson (Jude Law) as they embark on a thrilling adventure to unveil the identity of a cunning nemesis who threatens the peace of all England.

18. Morning Glory (2010)

Morning Glory (2010), starring Rachel McAdams, Harrison Ford, and Diane Keaton, tells the story of an ambitious television producer, Becky Fuller, who is tasked with reviving a flagging morning news show. As she navigates the tumultuous world of television, Becky must deal with the warring co-hosts, Mike Pomeroy and Colleen Peck. With strong performances from its leading stars and a blend of heartwarming comedy, drama, and romance, Morning Glory offers a captivating look at the realities of TV journalism and the challenges of balancing work and personal life.

20. Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows (2011)

Delve into the thrilling world of action, adventure, and mystery in the 2011 film, Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows. Set in Europe, the movie follows the relentless pursuit of criminal mastermind Professor Moriarty, who is orchestrating a series of random and daring heists across the continent. Enter the iconic duo of Sherlock Holmes, the brilliant detective played by Robert Downey Jr. , and his loyal companion Dr. John Watson (Jude Law). Together, they engage in a high-stakes game of cat and mouse with Moriarty, all while dealing with a gypsy woman (Noomi Rapace) who plays a pivotal role in their investigation.

About Timeâ€ is a captivating and heartwarming comedy drama that explores the power of second chances. With this newfound power, he embarks on a mission to make the world a better place by finding a loving companion.
